Key Match Events: The Dallas Mavericks erased a 10-point late lead by the Portland Trail Blazers
Dereck Lively II led the rally with 13 points in the final frame
Dallas uncorked a 16-0 blast that was capped off by Quentin Grimes' floater that pushed the Mavs ahead 115-109
Anfernee Simons went 0-of-4 in the last four minutes and committed two turnovers
Shaedon Sharpe went 0-of-2, committing three fouls and two turnovers
Post-Match Reflections: The Portland Trail Blazers collapsed late in the game, allowing the Dallas Mavericks to escape with a win
The Dallas Mavericks improved to 22-16 following the win, while the Portland Trail Blazers dropped to 13-24
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dallas Mavericks won the season series 3-1 against the Portland Trail Blazers
Dallas beat Portland 137-131 on Dec. 1 before taking a 2-0 series lead with a 132-108 victory on Dec. 23
The Blazers pulled off a 126-122 upset on Dec. 28 despite Kyrie Irving erupting for 46 points
Others: Fans reacted on X/Twitter to the Trail Blazers' collapse, with some calling it an 'unbelievable tank job'
Fans criticized the Trail Blazers' offense, saying it was too reliant on Simons and Sharpe
